H0.text: Amphibians are the broad group of animals that are the first true tetrapods, vertebrates with four limbs.

H1.text: Fish are the broad group of animals that are the first true tetrapods, vertebrates with four limbs.

H2.text: Reptiles are the first true tetrapods, vertebrates with four limbs.

H3.text: Mammals are the first true tetrapods, vertebrates with four limbs.

A4.text: The first major groups of amphibians developed in the Devonian period, around 370 million years ago, from lobe-finned fish which were similar to the modern coelacanth and lungfish.

A5.text: They diversified and became ecologically dominant during the Carboniferous and Permian periods, but were later displaced in terrestrial environments by early reptiles and basal synapsids (predecessors of mammals).
